Package javelin.model.unit.abilities.discipline

Class Strike

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.unit.abilities.discipline.Maneuver
      • javelin.model.unit.abilities.discipline.Strike
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Maneuver>, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DizzyingVenomPrana, IronFang, SickeningVenomStrike, StingOfTheAdder, StingOfTheAsp, StingOfTheRattler, WeakeningVenomPrana
    public abstract class Strike
extends Maneuver
    Lets the user select a standard attack (not a full sequence) then sets (and later clears) AbstractAttack.CURRENTMANEUVER and delegates to either MeleeAttack or RangedAttack. The line between Strikes and Boosts is often blurred, especially when the Boost only gives you a bonus to the next attack (like with DizzyingVenomPrana), in which case they are, effectively, a Strike. For Maneuver.ap, uses a ActionCost.SWIFT action (for the maneuver) plus a ActionCost.STANDARD action (for the attack), by default. validate(Combatant) requires that the given Combatant have at least one ranged or melee attack. * There isn't a pre/post "miss" methods yet because that would interfere with the AbstractAttack logic a little bit. TODO this is currently an experimental (but stable) API. After more experience with Maneuvers in general, it might be possible to remove methods.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • perform

        public boolean perform​(Combatant c)
        Description copied from class: Maneuver
        Delegate to Action.perform(Combatant). The implementations need not worry about handling the Combatant.ready(Maneuver) or Maneuver.spend().
        Specified by:
        perform in class Maneuver
        See Also:
        ExecuteManeuver

      • getoutcomes

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<ChanceNode>> getoutcomes​(Combatant c,
                                                              BattleState s)
        Description copied from class: Maneuver
        A delegate for AiAction.getoutcomes(Combatant, BattleState). By the time this is called, all parameters have already been properly cloned. The implementations need not worry about handling the Combatant.ready(Maneuver) nor Maneuver.spend().
        Specified by:
        getoutcomes in class Maneuver
        See Also:
        ExecuteManeuver

      • preattacks

        public abstract void preattacks​(Combatant current,
                                Combatant target,
                                Attack a,
                                BattleState s)
        Called before any DamageNodes are created. Useful for setting up effects and the like. This is also called only once per AbstractAttack run, making it preferable to prehit(Combatant, Combatant, Attack, DamageChance, BattleState).

      • postattacks

        public abstract void postattacks​(Combatant current,
                                 Combatant target,
                                 Attack a,
                                 BattleState s)
        Like posthit(Combatant, Combatant, Attack, DamageChance, BattleState) but for postattacks(Combatant, Combatant, Attack, BattleState).

      • prehit

        public abstract void prehit​(Combatant current,
                            Combatant target,
                            Attack a,
                            DamageChance dc,
                            BattleState s)
        Called before a strike hits. Mostly used to setup bonus damage, secondary effects, etc. BattleState and Combatants are already cloned. Make sure to clone Combatant.source internally, if necessary. Does not support randomness, so use take-10 rules whenever possible (for saving throws, etc). This is called before Attack.effect is taken into effect (if it is at all).
        Parameters:
        dc - Make sure to use this to apply extra damage so it will handle death, Monster.dr, etc.

      • posthit

        public abstract void posthit​(Combatant current,
                             Combatant target,
                             Attack a,
                             DamageChance dc,
                             BattleState s)
        Called after all damage consequences have been ealt with. Mostly used to clean-up prehit(Combatant, Combatant, Attack, DamageChance, BattleState) actions.
